snippet: A judge struck down a law that allows the F.B.I. to secretly seize subscriber information from Internet companies and other communications service providers without a warrant.
abstract: Federal District Court Judge Susan Illston strikes down California law that allows Federal Bureau of Investigation to secretly seize subscriber information from Internet companies and other communications service providers without a warrant.
lead_paragraph: A judge struck down a law that allows the F.B.I. to secretly seize subscriber information from Internet companies and other communications service providers without a warrant.

headline.seo: California: Judge Strikes Down Law on National Security Letters
headline.main: California: Judge Strikes Down Law on National Security Letters
headline.print_headline: California: Judge Strikes Down Law On National Security Letters
